cluster_relations.rel_desc: The evolution of tales over time affects the content and form of urban legends.

qualifiers.UncertaintyQualifier: implicit linkage between tales and specifically urban legends
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: Driver: to suit interests and fears of audiences

remarks: Assumes the general "tales" include urban legends described in this passage.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: As urban legends spread, they develop into new forms and variations.
cluster_relations.object_entity_name: new forms and variations of legends
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Narrative Truth, Sources, and Explanatory Roles

cluster_relations.rel_desc: The Hook Man legend exhibits new forms and variations of legends.
cluster_relations.object_entity_name: new forms and variations of legends
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Narrative Truth, Sources, and Explanatory Roles
remarks: Maps the general idea of variations onto this concrete legend instance.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that one narrative process or factor influences the content, form, or characteristics of another narrative or narrative category.
args.justification: The relation describes how the evolution of tales over time affects the content and form of urban legends, which is best captured as a directional influence rather than a transformation or identity relation.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that one narrative or legend gradually changes over time into new forms or variations.
args.justification: The description emphasizes that urban legends, during their spread, develop into new forms and variations, which is a classic evolution/transformation relation best normalized as 'evolves_into'.

Both relations concern how narratives change over time: one describes influential change in content/form, the other explicit evolution into new variants; these are members of the same broader family of narrative-evolution processes.
In both cases, the subject process (evolution or spread) is presented as causing or driving change in the resulting legends or their forms, fitting a causal/change-of-state dimension.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an entity (such as a specific legend) displays or embodies a particular characteristic, feature, or pattern.
args.justification: The Hook Man legend is said to exhibit 'new forms and variations of legends', meaning it displays this property rather than transforming into something else; a generic attribute-style predicate captures this best.

This relation expresses that a specific narrative instance has or displays a particular characteristic (being an example of new forms/variations), which falls under a broader class of narrative attribute/property relations.
The link is about a property that the legend exhibits, not about composition, hierarchy, or direct causality; it fits a broad attribute/feature dimension.
